level.heading: HOTEL ROOMS, LODGINGS, AND OTHER ACCOMMODATIONS (ยง 9-446)

level.text: For the purposes of the Act (D.C. Code ยง 47-2001(n)(1)(C)), a “transient” is a person who has the right to occupy any room or rooms, lodgings or accommodations for a period of ninety (90) days or less during any one continuous stay.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Commissioners’ Order 54-1415, 1 DCR 4 (July 19, 1954); as amended by Commissioners’ Order 56-890 effective May 9, 1956, 2 DCR 304 (May 21, 1956); and by Final Rulemaking published at 30 DCR 1922, 1927 (April 29, 1983).
